website_summaries.verdict: Stability and weight capacity are this transfer bench's best selling points. Very affordable, and very easy to assemble and install.
pros: Easy to assemble (no tools) and install
Suction cups provide stability in tub
Blown plastic molding is lightweight but sturdy
cons: Some water collection and rusting issues reported
Suction cups can be difficult to release

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I broke my leg and needed assistance while showering. It worked well for two months and then as I was getting out of the bench, the leg SNAPPED OFF. Thankfully, I was able to stabilize myself on the counter, but this bench could be very dangerous to someone requiring assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Meg.

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: 2 legs don't ever stay in. Anytime it is moved they fall out. Haven't been able to fix it. And the metal holding those legs is bending outward because the legs don't want to stay in while sitting on it. And yes, I am well below the product weight limit.
customer_reviews.author: Veonn E.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The suction cups on the two legs are hard to release. One of them came off, staying attached to the tub. It was incredible hard to get the suction cup back on the screw coming out the leg. A week later it came off again and now there is rust forming inside the leg and left all this red color in the tub - very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the job until it broke immediately after first month of use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my father who recently had his leg amputated. in less than 40 days the bench brace cracked, suction cups on legs dislodged and he fell getting into the shower. I wrote to the company today, requesting a free replacement of the product since my father is no where near the weight capacity and the product was clearly defective. Based on other reviews I am hoping that was just the case and not representive of their regular bench. I will update this review once I receive a response from the company so the next customer is aware of the product and company they are purchasing from.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shower bench yet (4th one in 17 yrs)
customer_reviews.text: Love this bench discovered it at a friend's house works both in a tub & awesome for roll on shower. The suction cups are amazing no more unwanted/unexpected chair sliding due to soap/hair product. Reversible handle makes access easy. The length allowed me to transfer & settle before sliding under the water & the width gives me enough space to bring my foot up to better access my legs for shaving & better access to reach & clean/scrub my feet
customer_reviews.author: Draven Corday

customer_reviews.title: Transfer bench arrived last Thursday and after assembled we realized ...
customer_reviews.text: Transfer bench arrived last Thursday and after assembled we realized it was not long enough and found another that has extra length but much more money. I requested a lable to return the unused bench and was told I could not return. Of the many things I have bought I don't believe I have ever returned any purchase but felt using the bench I purchased would be unsafe for someone recovering from a fractured femur and I already had the longer bench in my shopping cart. Thank you so much for your assistance Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: B. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must if you are temporary or permanently disabled
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Such a lifesaver. I’m about to have acl/meniscus surgery in a few weeks. I can’t use one leg at the moment, and i got this chair to make it safer to take showers. I’m about to safely get in and out of the shower by myself, makes it easier to access all parts of my body. Never once did i feel like i was going to slide onto the floor. I love how you can switch the direction of the handle, or choose to leave the back of the seat on on not. Please get this for your family member!
customer_reviews.author: Richard T Myers

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Edit- Amazon contacted me within the hour of emailing them and is handling the refund. Even though I was unhappy with the product, Amazon has such great customer service! Legs are wobbly, suction cups are poor. The entire device does not seem reliable, especially for a elderly person to use in the shower. Seems like it's be more hazerdous than assistive. Also very disappointed it is not returnable, as this is listed nowhere I can find for this item. Poorly made and would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Pass on drive brand products.
customer_reviews.text: Not well designed or manufactured. Parts come off rather easily and these are the ones installed at the factory. Drive tends to cut corners on quality control and on design. Also this has suction cups for the tub side. If you need to take it out and can't easily reach in to the bottom of the tub while not sitting on the bench you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Who wants to need one of these? But at least this one is very good!
customer_reviews.text: Who wants to use one of these? No one! But my Occupational Therapist told me to get one when I went home after 6 weeks of post-op inpatient physical rehab. It has helped a lot to keep me from tiring or slipping in the bath tub/shower. The section of the seat that sticks out of the bathtub makes it easy to get in, but it turned out to be a handy place to sit when I wasn't washing. The bench was very easy to assemble and adjust, and is light but seems sturdy. I can't wait to get rid of it, but it certainly met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: BobInBrooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is light weight but perfect to transition into and out of the tub. I purchased as I had broken a leg and during the recovery process I wanted to be able to shower. And it's amazing when you can't shower. One thing to keep in mind is you will need to put the shower curtain in between the shower seat and the transfer piece. There is a small slit where you want to put the curtain and make sure it goes in that slot or you'll be mopping the bathroom. I have had no other issues and am Thankful, the price was great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Brint Craze

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality, pros and con
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Sturdy 2. Adjustable height and legs for leveling 3. Very large Cons: 1. Very large 2. Textured surface could be irritating. Overall: I'm really impressed with the design and quality of this transfer bench. It's easy to dry myself before getting up or with legs outside the tub. Very stable and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Eve StarrTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on this product before I bought it. There are some who complained it wasn't easy to assemble. Bull. It went together just fine and without tools. It is pretty wide, so if you have a small tub in a small bathroom, you may want to use something smaller. A shower curtain is almost useless, as the chair has no real means of allowing the curtain to contain the water inside the tub. I'm happy with it though, she's able to get in and out more easily.
customer_reviews.author: OathKeeper

customer_reviews.title: Check return policy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tub bench upon the recommendation of the rehab facility where my mother was a patient, so she could have it at home once discharged. It arrived as advertised. I live 2 hours from my mother. By the time we got her home it was a week later and then she absolutely refused to use the tub bench. I only travel to see her every 1 -2 weeks. Now 14 days has passed, it has barely been out of the box, not used and I cannot return it! This return policy should be up front in the product description, not buried in the small print 3 screens later!! This is not good public relations!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable, brass pins stuck inside tubing, trouble with Amazon return -- won't take back
customer_reviews.text: Hard ordering safe in-home equipment online. This transfer bench was defective. Ordered on Jan 1st, put together yesterday, discovered brass pin connection issue. Have Parkinson's, need supportive equipment in bathroom. Customer service said they had to wait 72 hours to 'investigate.' Additionally, had to return two raised toilet sets from same order-- they wouldn't fit standard toilet even though they were specifically for standard toilets. This has been a very difficult Amazon shopping experience, and a expensive one. Have been so pleased with Amazon over the years, but not so hot this time around.
customer_reviews.author: steve N

customer_reviews.title: They are affordable and well built with easy assembly. Make sure to adjust the legs to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a home health occupational therapist and I have purchased 3 of these transfer benches for patients. They are affordable and well built with easy assembly. Make sure to adjust the legs to fit the tub as well as the floor so that the bench is flat and not tilted. Also make sure to test out the bench before having the patient (family member) transfer onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Crit

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 83. This chair made it easier for her to shower. We set the chair high so she can sit and get off the chair. The old one was too hard for her to try and stand because it was too low. This is kind of bulky.. But that's not a problem. The only thing... Is that when she was showering... The water leaked off the chair. But it's ok... Whatever makes it easier for her. Thank you :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Go By The Picture!
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair specifically because it showed the handle being on the left side of the chair and no it is on the right, can't see where you can change it .... The back support goes on either facing side but in the same area well needless to say my son wont be able to use the chair and it sits in the living room as an ornament now because I am stunned at what it CAN'T do...
customer_reviews.author: REINA

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Basic Tub Transfer Bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench is a very good value. It's the same one I used in the hospital and priced locally at almost $200! The back rest sets up on either side, as needed. The suction cups really hold in the tub, providing a stable situation. Tabs on the suction cups make removal easy. I was able to adjust the legs up to 20.5 inches in half-inch increments, just clearing my Jacuzzi tub. This seat is sturdy! No frills like the more expensive units, but I didn't need the frills.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Traveler

customer_reviews.title: bad design and no returns
customer_reviews.text: The build is good and it is easy to put together. Unfortunately, the design is wrong. On the handle side (the side that sits in the tub) they extend the frame for the handle and the legs passed the seat. This steals several inches from the seat and therefore the seat doesn't extend far enough into the tub and the seam doesn't line up with the outer edge of the tub (to slide the shower liner thru). So, they built it backwards, USELESS. And, to top that, IT IS NOT RETURNABLE.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Looks well designed for the purpose
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it yet, but it looks like it will work for visiting family members who need it. The legs were the only part that was tricky to assemble, as the directions referred to labels on the legs and sockets - but those weren't labled. Even so, there's only two kinds of legs and the photo made it pretty clear which ones go on which end. The legs did take a bit of hard pushing to get them into the plastic sockets, but then they slid right into place. I'd rather have them tight than wobbly, so I appreciated that. The suction cups grip well. The tricky part will be getting the shower curtain adjusted over the projecting part.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaguy

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, suction not so much
customer_reviews.text: This model was recommended by the rehab I stayed in. It is sturdy, and works as it should. Only problem I have with it is that the suction in the tub isn't that great and it keeps sliding to the drain hole. As with any transfer shower chair, you have to be careful to tuck the shower curtain underneath you and make sure the bottom is down far enough that you don't get water all over the floor. It also helps to put a hand towel down on the seat of this chair to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing definitely has a really great suction. It was pretty easy to assemble for the most part although it did take me some time to get it done. It was definitely a lot larger than I thought it was period once we got it into the tub we had to spend some time trying to even out the chair because the tub obviously is higher than the floor outside of the tub. My husband was able to use it without any issues and felt it helps his weight well.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Transfer Bench for Tub, Very Helpful, Very Easy to Put Together
customer_reviews.text: This bench was extremely easy to put together. The suction power is ok, not the best. Supports a large person, could be a bit sturdier. Easy to switch the back to the opposite side for changing position to enter tub. You do have to maneuver the shower liner around the top of the seat so water stays in the tub. Lightweight for carrying and placing over tub side. Adjustable leg heights allow for difference between tub floor and bathroom floor heights.
customer_reviews.author: The Major

customer_reviews.title: Great shower helper
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I both used this. Her after back surgery and me after Knee surgery. Makes it easy the get in and out of tub shower and if you have shower hose attachment easy to shower sitting down. Just sit down , swing legs over the edge of the tub, pull the shower curtain over the edge of the bench and enjoy your shower sitting down with out making a mess outside the tub. Great help for us. When you heal, lift it out, store it and get on with your life.
customer_reviews.author: C. Strain

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was in the hospital for three months due to cancer surgery (I had numerous complications) and needed this to use in my shower/tub. My rehab center had one exactly like it so I came to Amazon to see what they had. My sister had bought one similar for around $100. Once I saw this one for almost half that I asked her to return the other & I ordered this one. The suction cups are very strong! And it can support my weight (I weigh 220 lbs) easily. I highly recommend this brand because it delivers a sturdy seat at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: The Rifleman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to assemble but had to return
customer_reviews.text: This shipped fast, easy to assemble, the suction cups at feet are strong. The issue here is the toilet (elongated) is next to tub making entering from the front impossible. The other issue even though I measured was the legs hit the curve part of the tub making it unstable. If there was just 1/4” more space and more clearance to enter we would of kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J

customer_reviews.title: Shower bench failure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bench July 26 2020. My husband who weighs 230# well below the weight limit of 400# has used it about 3xweek for 9 -10 weeks, About 4 weeks ago I noticed the bottom of the chair was severely cracked. The cracks in the plastic are now starting to encircle the seat and come up to the top where his tender bottom sits. We are very disappointed that this item only lasted a brief time and now we will need to purchase another one. I do not recommend this item due to this. It did meet the goal of allowing my husband to get in and out of the shower safely and independently.
customer_reviews.author: beachbum beth

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Product cane with no assembly instructions. Small pieces were not in plastic bags. Just rolling around in box. Larger pieces in plastic bags that were not tied. Looks like sonething someone else returned. Disappointed. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: This bench is a must have when you are unable to stand for a shower!
customer_reviews.text: After a freak accident I had surgery on both legs. One leg was non weight bearing. This bench was a lifesaver! I set my wheelchair next to it and it was easy to transfer to it. The handle and arm rest make it easy to grab on to it and slide over. It works best if you have a shower nozzle that comes off and is handheld. This enables me to be more independent during my recovery. Thank you for a great product that makes me feel safe! I bought this with my own money, and is my honest review. If you feel this review was helpful, please click the helpful button so I know. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lytle

customer_reviews.title: A serious problem renders this bench dangerous for the use.
customer_reviews.text: I have changed my review to one star for the following reason. This Shower Bench has a serious problem that won't show until the item fails sometime after it is put into use. The problem is dissimilar metals in it's construction causing rust in either the bolts, nuts or something the bolts screw into. SEE MY SECOND REVIEW BELOW FOR DETAILS.
customer_reviews.author: Crumudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Relieved
customer_reviews.text: This a great bench , quality material & very sturdy , my 15 yr old grandson assembled it in a matter of minutes. Unfortunately I was not able to use it which had nothing to do with the bench , I had difficulty with my bathroom set up, I was very disappointed I couldn’t use it but the company was very understanding & I sent it back without any problems for a full refund . It’s bad enough to get older & have disabilities but this company made me feel so much better knowing there is a business out there that doesn’t try to take advantage of your situation , such a relief
customer_reviews.author: Seaman

customer_reviews.title: EASY assembly, cheap & functional.  What more could anyone ask for?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, great price & does exactly what it's supposed to do. After trying many of these the past few years, found this one to be the one I should have started with. Even bought a 'top of the line' model put out by a leading bathroom fixture company. Turned out to be the most troublesome thing ever invented for a disabled person. Assembly was a nightmare & use was just average. This simple model snapped together in minutes & for someone with the use of only one arm, a welcome & comforting thing. Function, easy to assemble, cheap. What more could I want?
customer_reviews.author: Deadat57

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built shower chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my elderly father after his previous chair rusted. This one appears to be very solidly constructed and it is very stable when installed. It took me less than 10 minutes to assemble, which is a plus. The legs are independently adjustable so you can get the right hight and angle for the seat and there are suction cups on the feet that sit in the tub/shower so you don't have to worry about it sliding around. My dad has used it for a couple of months and has no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Browncoats Unite!Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE DESIGN floods your floor
customer_reviews.text: This shower bench has a terrible design! The section of its seat that extends OVER the side of the tub and onto your bathroom floor has DRAINAGE HOLES in it just like the sections that are in the tub. Yup. You guessed it. Water gets all over your bathroom floor. Crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, good price but not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together and would be useful to any senior citizen under 150 lb. The bench is not that stable especially the backrest. I would not recommend anybody order this that maybe slightly to a little bit overweight because the backrest is a little loose. All in all, I can't complain. I am a caretaker and unfortunately will not be able to use this for my mom but her sister who weighs a little less than 120 lb and I gave it to her and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Love that I can get in and out of the shower on my own
customer_reviews.text: This transfer bench is wonderful. As a big women I was concerned to find one that would hold my weight. I can trust this bench. It makes getting into my high sided tub safe and easy. Highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a transfer bench.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy extender legs to make it fit in my claw foot tub, that's the only reason I dropped a star. I need this thing, and it keeps me from falling in the shower. It has to come and go, cause my boyfriend can't use the toilet if it's in the tub, and it's usual home is in the kitchen, but that's to be expected in a house built in 1850. Not much space anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: I told them this is too wide for my tub. Trying to get into the tub is dangerous. If i turn it sideways i have to try to sit on it and turn my legs around to use it as a bench. Its dangerous for a 75 year old woman. They refuse to take it back. The dimensions they show are not correct.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I need new suction cups after a few months. Help, Amazon!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this bench a few months, and the suction cups no longer work, rendering it useless to me.. I’m writing this in the hope that Amazon sees it, and either sends me replacement suction cups, or, if they don’t have them, a replacement bench. I’ve always had GREAT customer service from Amazon, so let’s hope that it continues with this bench!
customer_reviews.author: Jewels357

customer_reviews.title: Physical Therapist Recommends This One!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Home Health Physical Therapist. I recommend this bench to my patients. I even bought one for my uncle for Christmas! It is easy to set up and adjustable for a variety of bathtubs. Sitting down on the bench and then lifting your legs over the edge of the tub is safe and easy. Great for anyone with balance issues or where you cannot install a grab bar on the wall near the tub. I have never run into any issues with the use of this bench with my patients. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Let's Go Hokies

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is the one we kept because my son also bought one for me not knowing that I had ordered one, but this is one of the most useful items that I've found since I broke my leg very badly and couldn't put weight on it for more than a month. It makes showering very easy, and I really think it's great for someone recovering from an injury or someone unable to put weight on one or both legs.
customer_reviews.author: tootsfolks

customer_reviews.title: Difficult!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pain in the butt to figure out the correct height of each leg on this tub transfer chair. I set up the chair by myself & found I had to readjust the height of each leg several times as the floor & tub interior are not equally level. I had difficulty deciphering the holes as they circle around and up the underside of the legs of the chair. In addition, lifting the chair from the tub is not easy because of the super-strength suction cups. Once the height is FINALLY perfected, however, the chair itself is sturdy & secure. I wouldn’t recommend this product unless it rarely needs to be moved.
customer_reviews.author: beckalaa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get the chance to try it!!
customer_reviews.text: This chair actually seems to be adequate for the job but I am extremely upset that when we received the chair the bottom extension legs weren't included in the package!! My mom was so looking forward to a shower after breaking her ankle and being non weight bearing which means she can't get into the shower without the assistance of the bench. I have put in for a refund for this item and reordered from a different company!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Tobey

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking... Buy now!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 33 250+ pound female...I had foot surgery a month ago (Achilles tendon repair) and have been completely non weight bearing. I just now bought this bench because I was told I still have another 3 weeks to go. I should have bought this sooner! Assembly was super easy and it worked fantastic. I didn't use chair back but I did install the hand rail. I was easily able to transition from my walker to the bench and slide over into the tub. I used the hand rail to stand up a few times to adjust my shower head. It was sturdy and held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this product on the yellow setting for fear any of the other colors will aggravate my rosacea. I have been using it for three weeks now. I have noticed hyperpigmentation reduction and reduced flushing. I apply Distinction Firmalift's and Cosmetic Skin Solutions Vitamin C 20% w/ Ferulic Acid serum prior to placing the mask on my face. My only complaints are the mask is a bit heavy and the lighting did trigger a mild headache after the first use. Since then, I have placed cotton balls over my eyes to reduce light exposure. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C

customer_reviews.title: Essential for bathing the disabled
customer_reviews.text: Bought for mother who suffered a stroke; it is exactly what the physical therapist recommended. She can sit down on it while still on the dry floor because one side of it sticks out of the bath. Then she can scoot over into the tub, wash and swing her feet back out where her shoes are waiting with little risk of slipping and falling. It isn't attached to the wall so assembly was a breeze and it will come right out if she regains her mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Durham

customer_reviews.title: Life Saving
customer_reviews.text: You don't wan't you or your loved ones falling in the shower or any part of the bathroom. Those hard surfaces can be serious and potentially life threatening. This bench does everything as advertised as is easy to assemble and disassemble. Though if you don't have the hand/arm strength, you may need to ask for some help. The fittings can be tight, but that's because they're not meant to wobble. Light enough to carry out of the bathroom when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony McCurley

customer_reviews.title: necesity
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who has had a loved one have a head injury or stroke knows the importance of independance in recovery.This bench ws suggested by the rehab stff. it is just right for making the trnsition from Acute Rehabe to home and helping the loved one feel independent. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: mbondsart

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good bath chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good bath chair for the price, but it seems a little rickety. I had to rig up a piece of plastic to go from under the chair into the tub to prevent a mess on the floor during the shower. Also, I plugged up all of the holes on the left side (shown) to keep water from dripping through the holes onto the floor. I have an old house with a pretty good size bathtub, but the chair still had to be placed over the ledge so it is half in and half out. It works now that I have modified how it works. It was really easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Nature

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made material.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: It was easy to assemble and use. Was useing this for my sister who is recovering from pneumonia. Dislikes: Last time we used it and removed it from the tub the front right leg metal just ripped apart from the frame.
customer_reviews.author: ikeman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and extremely sturdy with strong suction
customer_reviews.text: This chair was assembled in 10 minutes with the easy to follow instructions and no tools required. Everything fit perfectly without a need to force anything. It is rated for 400 pounds and it held over 300 with no problem. The adjustability is awesome. The suction cups in the tub held so well they were difficult to pull up to move the chair so be sure you put it where you want it first. Very glad to have made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Jones

customer_reviews.title: I recieved parts out of shape or bent
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 185 and it was scary to take a shower because of the wobble. My opinion is: not worth buying and is non returnable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elderly Father
customer_reviews.text: My 90 year old father has fallen several times in the last few months. I cannot really afford a bathroom remodel so I decided to try this chair. My dad is 6 "4. The chair adjust to a safe height and is very sturdy. I feel so much more comfortable now that he has this chair. I can supervise his showers. He sits most of the time and when he needs to stand, their is a rail for him to use to balance himself and hold on to for safety. Love It!!!! Great Buy!!! Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Red Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother to use after her hip surgery. She loves it! Very sturdy and the wide seat with the back provide more safety than many other shower seats. The option to sit on it brute getting into the shooter is good. I was worried it would be too big for her small tub and bathroom but it worked out great. Totally recommend. She has told me several times how much she loves it. She does use a hand held shower attachment to make bathing easier which may be idea if your buying going to be using the seat.
customer_reviews.author: nancpance

customer_reviews.title: Great bench and a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother-in-law, who had knee surgery and is in her 70s. This worked very well for your purposes. The suction cups are very strong and it took some work to pry them up when we needed to haul them out of the shower. But better to be strong than to be weak as it insured that the bench didn't move around on her when entering or exiting the wet shower. Assembly was straight forward. The bench is light and easy to move around. We were glad we got this.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Same as used in many hospitals.
customer_reviews.text: My mom had a hip replacement surgery. We bought this item for her tub/shower. It's light weight, easy to assemble, and study. Holds 300 lbs I believe. She was nervous about using a shower transfer bench as she is overweight, but she felt comfortable with this bench. Same one used at the physical therapy rehab center she went to after the surgery. It does the job and is a quality product. No complaints. It's not bulky, Hugs the side of the tub nicely.
customer_reviews.author: LSUATX83

customer_reviews.title: Tub bench
customer_reviews.text: Photos showed the bench being used in a standard tub. That is not how it was when we attempted to use it. We were unable to use it as the majority of the bench was outside the tub. Several healthcare professionals tried to make it work, unsuccessfully. If you buy it, make sure you have a very large tub.
customer_reviews.author: kfgaskins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bench for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had both knees replaced and is able to shower by himself right after coming home. It's solid and easy to put together. His occupational therapist said this is the one he'd have told him to get because he can sit on the side and safely get himself in the tub unlike the regular seats that only sit inside the tub.
customer_reviews.author: K Petty

customer_reviews.title: Medical Tub Bench
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to use with a fixed shower head. 100% unable to use. Refused to allow me to return it. I was out the money for something that did not work. I was in the hospital & in rehab. By the time I got to come home the return deadline was past. NOT FAIR!! The time frame was out of my hands. Please advise if reconsideration in returning it is an option. TY
customer_reviews.author: Mims

customer_reviews.title: Shower Stool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother in-law. She is not steady on her feet. She is afraid of falling yet she is very independent. She sits on the outside of the tub, then while sitting puts her feet in. This makes it so much easier for her to get in and out of the bath tub. It gives her the freedom to take a bath or shower when she wants to. I recommend this for anyone who is unsteady on their feet.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie bork

customer_reviews.title: Great for my big and tall dad with a stroke
customer_reviews.text: My dad is 6'5" almost 400lbs and after a massive stroke several years ago, he is unsteady on his feet and tires easily. After a rehab stay recently they suggested a bariatric chair as he has difficulty lifting leg high enough to get over the tub and it throws his balance. Our toilet is right next to the tub and I was worried with this chair he wouldnt be able to use the toilet as well, but he can! Its great my dad can shower by himself again.
customer_reviews.author: GeanBeanz

customer_reviews.title: Useful and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This tub/shower chair straddles the bathtub, so a person with limited mobility can sit down on it outside the tub and swivel in to bathe or shower. It's not at all difficult to put together, and adjusting the height is easy, too. You can assemble it to face either direction that is appropriate for any tub. A friend of mine who has a broken leg is using it and it's working well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Maidens

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy chair that stays in place in the tub
customer_reviews.text: A well designed, very sturdy chair that stays in place in the tub. Can change which side the back goes on, so you can easily make use of this in a bathtub. Sitting on the edge while outside the bathtub feels secure. The wide feet that go on the inside of the tub stay secure to the bottom of the bathtub and do not move. Excellent product with a great price.
customer_reviews.author: gyk

customer_reviews.title: The best bathroom chair option.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a chair that was completely in the tub - the problem being that my grandmother had to carefully balance herself when she was wet as she stepped over the tub. This solves that problem b/c she scoots over and is never balancing herself stepping over the tub side. Definitely purchase if you are worried about slipping as you step over the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Christina H

customer_reviews.title: Child of Senior Parent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my senior parent. This has been absolutely a great purchase. They have difficulty getting into the tub and this sets slightly outside, so it allows them to sit and then bring their legs over the tub edge. Due to the daily use of this products, this is the second one purchased. It will rust over time. and the plastic does wear, but I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother after she had open heart surgery so that she would be able to get in and out of the shower easier. My 11 year old son actually put it together. It's very easy to put together and to change which side the seat is on. So it's very versatile for whichever bathtub you have.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very awkward to use. When sitting I was over the edge of tub rather than center. Too hard for a disabled person to remove it to clean the tub. Because of it sticking so far out of tub couldn’t position the shower curtain to keep water from flooding the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great product for shower stability.
customer_reviews.text: This shower transfer bench arrived quickly and in great condition. It was easy for me to assemble and set up in our tub/shower combination and eliminated the need to have extra handrails installed in the tile to provide the stability my husband needed to shower with little assistance after a fall and hospitalization. It does take up some space and may not be suitable for small bathrooms but it works very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: cathyvee

customer_reviews.title: This product was defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bench after my husband had hip replacement surgery and after about three months use, heard a loud pop during use. Turned the bench over and saw that the middle piece of bench had cracked. Over the next several uses it continued to crack more until I felt it was dangerous to use. This bench is designed to accommodate a three hundred pound person - my husband weighs 165 lbs. I feel this product was defective from the start and should be guaranteed for longer than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Zulette  harris

customer_reviews.title: Makes showering easier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bench because my wife required it to due a recent injury(ies). I find it easier to use rather than remove when I need a shower. I do not sit on it the whole time I am in the shower but it affords a safety element I find comforting as well as very handy to sit on while washing my feet. We we continue to use it even after my wife no longer requires it. The only slight drawback is making the shower curtain work but it is relatively easy to accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom Safety
customer_reviews.text: Used this extended tub bench in both a walk-in shower and a Jacuzzi tub. Did not install the backrest, only the side handrail, because I wanted maximum flexibility. Was able to easily transfer from crutches/scooter into shower without concern of falling. But also found I could transfer into the the Jacuzzi tub and soak my swollen fractured ankle in the whirlpool jets (with doctor's approval) and that felt great! Would recommend highly to anyone needing this type of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: JBAC Mom

customer_reviews.title: Hospital-grade
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality item -- it was easy to assemble, is sturdy and grips our ceramic tub so hard it's actually a challenge to pry the suction cups off. It gives me confidence to know my dad will be OK on his own in the shower, allowing him the autonomy and privacy he wants. It's the one the hospital recommended, and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: I bought the first one of these 3 years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first one of these 3 years ago, and had no problems until one of the legs bent badly enough I was afraid to use it. Being familiar with the chair, and it did last 3 years, I bought another. It claims a weight limit of 400 lbs. I weigh 240. The price is right, so I guess I don't have anything to complain about. Only 4 stars however due to the suspect weight limit claim.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Brumfield (avid reader)

customer_reviews.title: Best shower seat after knee replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this seat for my MIL after her knee replacement surgery to help her in the shower. It is wonderful! It has big suction cups to secure the legs inside the tub and is very sturdy and does not slip. The seat is smooth and does not irritate skin for sliding across the seat after sitting down on the end. She loves it and is so happy with how easy it is for her to be able to take a shower without help even though she is still using a walker after her surgery. Well worth the purchase price!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: It suctions down really well no slipping
customer_reviews.text: I love my shower bench ,its so much better than a regular shower chair ,i just had my second total knee replacement ,this bench seat has been a gods send i have a really small bathroom but its been easy to use this i just back my walker up to it sit down and slide right over ,you can also pull your shower curtain around it and you dont get water on the floor .
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Stone

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this chair.
customer_reviews.text: This product came broken. I had read other reviews that complained about missing parts but I ordered this chair anyway. I can’t wait for a replacement chair because that will mean days without bathing. I only need it for a short time while I heal. Just be careful if your thinking about ordering this chair
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Miller

customer_reviews.title: Must have for
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mom after she had hip Replacement surgery. Setting it up was easy however one of the buttons would not come out all the way which made me A bit nervous about the sturdiness of the bench however my mom says this is definitely a must have she loves it and doesn’t know what she would do without it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Must have for knee surgeries!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally a life saver. I’ve had 2 knee surgeries this year and didn’t think I needed one for the 1st one, but it was required for the 2nd. Once I realized how much safer it was I regretted not having it for the 1st for sure. I weight 270 and have had no issues with stability. It actually held up when I slipped and fell onto it a couple weeks ago. So lucky it was there, would have been a completely different outcome for sure.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Company
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the backrest for my mom. Also my father died on Labor Day, it's been a difficult time for me. I contacted the company twice about a missing part and defective leg of backrest. I wanted the parts, because I like the backrest. I was advised to email pictures of the parts that I wanted repaired and the missing piece. When I emailed the company I received an undeliverable alert so I contacted the company and I was given another email address and it didnt work either. By that time the return period had expired.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item!!! This was recommended by my physical therapist. Just had double knee replacement, this was the perfect solution. I couldn’t get in the shower because I couldn’t lift my legs over the side of the tub. Highly recommend to any one with limited mobility of one or both legs!
customer_reviews.author: Patti S

customer_reviews.title: WILL CAUSE YOUR FLOOR TO GET REALLY WET!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't fit like it should have in my moms bathtub, the outside of it had to be adjusted a lot higher than inside the bathtub and my mom felt uncomfortable on it! I warned her that it would get her floor really wet when she showered, but she didn't think it would be very bad and it was. I've had one before so I know how much the floor gets really wet!
customer_reviews.author: La Quetta Jo Ray

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Does the job very well. Allowed me to shower after a leg surgery with comfort and safety. Being able to use the transfer board to get into the tub makes the difference. Do not settle for a regular shower stool. Only complaint was no instructions in the box, though video on product page explains everything.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Save time and money, get this one.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Easy to switch from facing shower to facing away - just switch backrest to other side. All legs are height-adjustable. Just make sure each one clicks in place. Saw some negative reviews where the leg fell off. No way this can happen, unless you didn't get them clicked in place properly. It is worth double-checking. Ever so sturdy, once you have the tabs popped in place. Great price. If you are looking for a wide, easy entry shower chair, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Suedotcom

customer_reviews.title: Hazardous. I wouldn't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandmother who was moving in with us from a nursing home. Finally got her and the suctions didn't stick to the tub at all and the leg of the chair broke as I was getting her out thank goodness I was in there she could have seriously hurt herself
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that your floor will get soaked. You may have to turn the chair backwards to have elderly in tight bathrooms if they have issues maneuvering their legs. It is much easier for bathing them than a regular shower chair. Put a bath mat down outside the tub for slips and lots of towels.
customer_reviews.author: Pepperseven

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was the impossible dream -
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! Sent it back because it was defective: The instructions were poor - and, therefore, cost unreimbursed time - but poor instructions didn't matter much because one set of legs would not insert into the correct base part (or the incorrect one, either!) because the angle was wrong - BUT, a greater flaw was that the other two leg receptacles were capped, quite securely! There was no point in giving the project more than the hour or so that we did, because it could NOT be assembled!
customer_reviews.author: DeepBasin

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair for my cousin, who’s 40, who recently had a stroke. Last year she had the gastric bypass surgery and this year a stroke. It’s been tough on her but thankfully she had dropped a lot of weight before she had the stroke. She loves this chair, easy for her to use with or without nurse assistance
customer_reviews.author: Samone Rich

customer_reviews.title: After surgery, shower bench needed.
customer_reviews.text: Needed shower bench after total knee replacement. If you have cane, crutches, walker &/or commode - PLEASE advise the hospital physical therapy & nurse. Due to my need for commode, crutches & walker, my INSURANCE WOULD NOT COVER SHOWER BENCH COST!!! Though approximately only $56.00, still expenses add up. Product does work, thank goodness. But please consider measurements. Was tight in bathtub & outside tub area. My bathroom is narrow. Again was very happy with product, beats shower chair. Just read above details, PLEASE!
customer_reviews.author: Dee R.

customer_reviews.title: Yes ... great for shower entry!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! If you've ever seen someone after surgery try and crawl into a shower because they can't step over the shower lip that keeps the water in, then this wonderful chair is what is needed. Yes, you can't close the shower door completely but a good bath mat catches most all overspray if you have a hand held shower wand. It makes entering a shower & showering a joy again. Again, I love this but have not yet tried it on a bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A Olson

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment Buttons are an "engineering" joke.
customer_reviews.text: Whoever 'engineered' this obviously didn't graduate past a High School Engineering Degree. The adjustment buttons are as cheap as they come because it doesn't take any effort for them to get shoved and lost down the leg pipes for you to struggle to fish them out with impossibly thin tools. I have never seen buttons this sloppily thrown in there with so much wiggle room. Absolutely ridiculous. You turn a 2 minute assembly into an hour long one just to find something to pull the buttons back out.
customer_reviews.author: Lili B.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Transfer bench was just what I needed after badly breaking both ankles. Was easy to transfer to from wheelchair, etc. However the bench only lasted 2 months. I only weigh 155 lbs & Bench rated to 350 lbs. however the hollow bench seat started cracking from the underside and became unstable. Needed cross bars or something beneath bench and maybe this would not have happened. It was great while it lasted but then had to be trashed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good utility but can be shaky
customer_reviews.text: Good utility, and I appreciate the ability to adjust the height and back position. Feels much safer for the patient to have this in the tub, and a handle bar. But it’s a little shaky when the legs are in the tallest position, and you need to check that the foot suction is still fixed on the ground with each use. I also had to order a 2nd time, as some of the connections were jammed on the 1st delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Brown

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement shower chair for me. Let me tell you it is so much better, more sturdy and way easier to use. After reading some of the reviews, I was nervous because of the suction cups being to powerful. I dont have a problem with them, I am a 45 years old and can only put weight on 1 foot and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: MWP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and recommended by physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble. Very sturdy. The physical therapist who comes to our house said it was the best one I could have bought for my husband. Good product and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy. it worked like I'm sure it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy. it worked like I'm sure it's supposed to, but it was VERY difficult to pry back out of the tub, and so cumbersome to wash/sanitize. but if you're elderly and/or have had knee surgery and need to get in and out of a tub/shower, you might need one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for tubs!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my needs. I have a knee fracture and a complete ACL tear. This allows me to safely shower, with no strain. You simply sit, slide over, and shower without any weight on the knee! I’ve had this for a month, and use it every day, and will use it for several more months during recovery. Very easy to assemble, and the suction works great. No slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful aid
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great aid for getting in & out of tub/shower. I broke my femur and cannot stand to shower. This has been very useful and will be for many more weeks. My husband put it together & he said it was easy to assemble. Very happy with item.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: When you are recovering from hip replacement, you want products that are sturdy and confidence-building. This bench has been an excellent addition for my ability to function on my own. It is easy slide across and high enough to traverse across my high sided bathtub. Handles and suction cups are incredibly useful. The seat holes help with drainage after a shower. You can rely on this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Finley

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed, for less than half the price of the local medical implements store. Would get again.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother-in-law. Went together easily and worked well. Cost less than half of what the local medical equipment supply store charges. (Seriously? They mark up their equipment that much?!) Would get this again.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Plastic Tub Transfer Bench with Adjustable Backrest (Color May Vary)
product_meta.description: Upgrade your bathroom with the Drive Medical Plastic Tub Transfer Bench with Adjustable Backrest; the ideal accessory for anyone who has difficulty getting in and out of the tub or shower. This seat features a reversible bench and extension legs with extra-large suction cups that help lock it into place for added versatility and safety. The plastic transfer bench has a pinch-free lever that allows the push pins to be depressed without accidentally squeezing fingers. It features tool-free assembly for the back, legs and arms. It also comes with "Dual Column" extension legs that are adjustable in .5" increments. This Drive Medical Transfer Bench has a sturdy A-frame design with a backrest that ensures maximum stability. It is also constructed of durable, blown plastic that is designed to withstand daily use. New "A" frame construction provides additional stability. Back support is reversible to accommodate left or right tub entry.
feature_bullets: The Bathtub Transfer Bench is designed to assist individuals while entering and exiting the bath for renewed independence
Blow-molded plastic bath bench and backrest ensure maximum stability and are reversible to accommodate any bathroom
Tool-free transfer bench assembly of back, legs, and arm, including pinch-free lever for extra installation safety
Bath seat height adjusts in ½” increments with versatile dual-column extending legs
Seat dimensions: 18.5-19.5”(D) x 26”(W) x 17.5-22.5”(H); Outside legs: 23”(D) x 32”(W)

Product weight- 10 pounds, outside legs depth- 23 inches, Outside legs width- 32 inches, overall product height- 17.75 inches, overall product length- 19.75 inches, overall product width- 29 inches, Primary product material- aluminum, product weight capacity- 400 pounds, seat depth- 18.5 inches-19.5 inches, Seat width- 26 inches, Seat to floor height- 17.5 inches-22.5 inches
